SendKnit

Bringing Ugly to the Masses

Custom Skis

Even Your Dad will Love

Oh Deer...

A Pixel Based Experiment

I've been interested in the pixel art trend that has becoming more popular. However, I wanted to try something a little bit different. I figured that my love of ugly sweaters was the perfect motivation.

Pining for More?

Each "V" Hand Placed

Each element of the pattern had to be created, one by one, by placing each white "v." The stiches "v" design is bilaterally symmetrical meaning that only pieces can only be reflected over the y-axis.

Snow Problem!

Every Snowflake is Different, Right?

The snowflake is the center of the ski. However, the ski binding will obscure most of this pattern. The rest of the ski is mirrored on both sides of the binding so you don't miss out on any other ugly bit.

SendKnit

Seneca Skis

These ski (topsheet) graphics were created, as a concept, for Seneca Skis based out of Bozeman,MT. The "S" seen on this part of the ski is a replication of Senca's logo. This was probably one of the most time consuming pattern pieces to create.

Wait there's More

52 Card Pick Up

Dealing with Ugly

A Custom Card Deck

This is a work in progress. I wanted to see where else I could take the stiching pattern design. I have already created the four suits (aces) and the back of the playing card. It's my plan to design the remaing 12 cards before the 2016 holiday season.
